title.narrative: Kathmandu Valley Water Supply Improvement Project

description.narrative: ADB and the Government of Nepal are working together to help the residents of the Kathmandu Valley to obtain greater access to clean water on a long-term basis. The Kathmandu Valley Water Supply Improvement Project is working to improve the efficiency and the reliability of the water supply system in the area while at the same time upgrading the infrastructure at the water source areas through a related project that is constructing the Melamchi tunnel and expanding the water treatment plant This project is expanding reservoirs, capacity and providing water connections with a focus on serving the poor and households headed by women. The long-term goal of the project is to provide affordable, clean water to the people of Kathmandu Valley for years to come.

participating-org.narrative: Kathmandu Valley Water Supply Management Board
Ministry of Water Supply (formerly Ministry of Water Supply and Sanitation)

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved access, efficiency, and reliability of water supply services to residents of Kathmandu Valley including poor women and men

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Average pressure of supply at consumer-end increased from almost 0 meter in 2011 to at least 4 meter in all areas in 2016

description.narrative: Improved access, efficiency, and reliability of water supply services to residents of Kathmandu Valley including poor women and men

title.narrative: Compliance of water samples with national drinking water quality standards increased to more than 95% in 2016

description.narrative: Improved access, efficiency, and reliability of water supply services to residents of Kathmandu Valley including poor women and men

title.narrative: Average supply improved from less than 1 hour every 4 days in 2011 to more than 2 hours daily in at least 80% of service area by 2016. At least 13 DMAs in service area (baseline 0) provided with 24x7 water supply.

description.narrative: Improved access, efficiency, and reliability of water supply services to residents of Kathmandu Valley including poor women and men

title.narrative: Average availability of water improved from 45 lpcd in 2011 to 135 lpcd in at least 80% of service area in 2016

description.narrative: Improved access, efficiency, and reliability of water supply services to residents of Kathmandu Valley including poor women and men
